statements: SELECT * FROM customers WHERE id = 1;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE segment = 'VIP';
SELECT id, name, satisfaction_level FROM customers WHERE email LIKE '%@gmail.com';
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY satisfaction_level DESC;
SELECT id, name, email, segment FROM customers WHERE satisfaction_level > 80;
SELECT name, email FROM customers WHERE satisfaction_level > 5 ORDER BY satisfaction_level DESC LIMIT 10
SELECT * FROM customers WHERE segment = 'Premium' ORDER BY name ASC, email DESC
SELECT name, email, segment FROM customers WHERE satisfaction_level BETWEEN 3 AND 7 ORDER BY segment ASC, name DESC
SELECT name, satisfaction_level FROM customers WHERE segment = 'Regular' ORDER BY name ASC LIMIT 5
SELECT * FROM customers ORDER BY satisfaction_level DESC, name ASC

SELECT customer_name, satisfaction_level FROM customers WHERE customer_id = 1;

SELECT customer_name, campaign_name FROM customers c JOIN marketing_campaigns m ON c.customer_id = m.campaign_id;
SELECT * FROM customers CROSS JOIN marketing_campaigns;
